wikipedia_page.main: Tony McNamara (3 October 1929 – 30 May 2015) was an English footballer who played as a winger. He would become the first football player to play in all four divisions in England within the space of 12 months, as he played for Crewe Alexandra and then Bury.

response: 13 December 1957: Evertonian Tony McNamara heads across Stanley Park to join Liverpool.
* 30 May 2015: Tony McNamara, 85, former Everton, Liverpool, Crewe Alexandra and Bury winger.
* Tony McNamara (writer) (born 1967), Australian writer for film and television
